ClubAccept(IUser)

Accepts a user's application to join the club.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubAccept")]
[Aliases("ClubAccept")]
[Priority(1)]
public Task ClubAccept(IUser user)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser user

The user whose application will be accepted.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

This command accepts an application based on the user's name. It adds the user to the club and notifies the invoker.

Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser toAdmin

The user whose admin status will be toggled.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command attempts to toggle the specified user's administrative status in the club. It notifies the invoker of the result.

Declaration

[Aliases("ClubApps")]
public Task ClubApps()
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command shows all users who have applied to join the club. It allows the club owner to manage these applications.

Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser user

The user to be banned.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command bans a specified user from the club, preventing them from rejoining. It requires club owner privileges to execute.

ClubBans()

Displays the list of users banned from the club.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubBans")]
[Aliases("ClubBans")]
public Task ClubBans()
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command fetches and displays a list of users who are banned from the club. If the club does not exist or there are no bans, it provides an appropriate message.

| Edit this page View Source

ClubCreate(string)

Creates a new club with the specified name.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubCreate")]
[Aliases("ClubCreate")]
public Task ClubCreate(string clubName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string clubName

The name of the club to be created.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command creates a new club with the given name. It checks for name validity and uniqueness. On success, it notifies the invoker; on failure, it provides an error message.

Updates the description of the club.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubDescription")]
[Aliases("ClubDescription")]
public Task ClubDescription(string? desc = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string desc

The new description for the club. If null, the description is removed.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command allows for the modification of the club's public description. It requires club owner privileges to execute.

ClubDisband()

Disbands the club, removing all members and deleting it.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubDisband")]
[Aliases("ClubDisband")]
public Task ClubDisband()
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command permanently deletes the club and notifies the owner of the outcome. It requires club owner privileges to execute.

ClubIcon(string?)

Sets or updates the club's icon.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubIcon")]
[Aliases("ClubIcon")]
public Task ClubIcon(string? url = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string url

The URL of the new club icon. If null, the current icon will be removed.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command updates the club's icon to a new image from the provided URL. If the URL is invalid or the operation fails, it notifies the invoker.

| Edit this page View Source

ClubInformation(IUser?)

Displays information about a club based on a member or a club name.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubInformation")]
[Aliases("ClubInformation")]
[Priority(1)]
public Task ClubInformation(IUser? user = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser user

The user whose club information will be displayed. If null, the command invoker's club will be used.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

Overloaded method that either takes a user to find their club or directly takes a club name. It displays detailed information about the club, including members and their roles.

ClubLeaderboard(int)

Displays the leaderboard of clubs based on their total XP.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubLeaderboard")]
[Aliases("ClubLeaderboard")]
public Task ClubLeaderboard(int page = 1)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int page

The page number of the leaderboard to display.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command fetches and displays a page of the club leaderboard, sorted by club XP. It provides a view into the most active and engaged clubs within the community.

Type Name Description

The level requirement for joining the club.

Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command updates the club's level requirement for new members. It is used to ensure that only users of a certain level can join.

Transfers the ownership of the club to a new owner.

Declaration
[Cmd("ClubTransfer")]
[Aliases("ClubTransfer")]
public Task ClubTransfer(IUser newOwner)
Parameters
Type Name Description
IUser newOwner

The user to whom the ownership will be transferred.
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command initiates a transfer of club ownership. If successful, it notifies the command invoker of the transfer. Otherwise, it reports a failure to transfer.

Clubleave()

Leaves the current club.

Declaration
[Cmd("Clubleave")]
[Aliases("Clubleave")]
public Task Clubleave()
Returns
Type Description
Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
Remarks

The command allows a user to leave their current club. It ensures the user is part of a club before proceeding with the operation.
